input: Freedom of conscience under the Constitution of India is subject to (CDS 2015-II) P. public order, morality and health Q. a law providing for social welfare and reform R. opening Hindu religious institutions of a public character to all Hindus S. defamation or incitement to an offence Select the correct answer using the code given below.
explanation: The Constitution of India provides the freedom of conscience in the following fields- (i) Morality, health, public order, laws for social welfare and reform, any religious institutions for propagation of their views and philosophy. (ii) To defame an offence.
